instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-0923: What is 820-0923? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PP3V3_G3H: What is PP3V3_G3H? PP3V3_G3H is a 3.3v power line that is present when the machine is in a Global System Hardware Off state, and should come on before most other rails so that the USB-C circuitry can be powered for the charger.
definitions.PPDCIN_G3H: What is PPDCIN_G3H? PPDCIN_G3H Is a power rail that comes directly from the laptop charger..
definitions.PP3V3_UPC_XA_LDO: What is PP3V3_UPC_XA_LDO? PP3V3_UPC_XA_LDO is an LDO coming out of the CD3215 USB-C muxing chip. When this is missing, either a capacitor on the line has shorted, PP3V3_G3H is missing, or the CD3215 is bad..
definitions.PP1V1_UPC_XA_LDO_BMC: What is PP1V1_UPC_XA_LDO_BMC? PP1V1_UPC_XA_LDO is an LDO coming out of the CD3215 USB-C muxing chip. When this is missing, either a capacitor on the line has shorted, PP3V3_G3H is missing, or the CD3215 is bad..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-0923</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> don't charge or boot
threads.message:
Hi,
Board is water damage, most corrosion was in the little caps around the XA/XB USB port connector. Also <CAPACITOR>C3101</CAPACITOR> was looking nasty, I replace the caps, no shorts detected, just ugly caps.
When I plug the original charger with an amp meter I get steady 5.11V in XA port. XB port pulses 5 seconds in 5.11V then goes to 0V for 1 second and up to 5.11V. Ports on the other side do the same.

I replace <CHIP>U3100</CHIP>, but keeps doing the same.

<SIGNAL>PP3V3_G3H</SIGNAL> = 3.39V
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_UPC_XA_LDO</SIGNAL> 3.36V
<SIGNAL>PP20V_USBC_XA_VBUS</SIGNAL>= 5.11V
<SIGNAL>PPDCIN_G3H</SIGNAL> = 5.12V
<SIGNAL>UPC_XA_GATE1</SIGNAL> = 11.01V
<SIGNAL>UPC_XA_GATE2</SIGNAL> = 7.18V
<SIGNAL>PP1V8_UPC_XA_LDOA</SIGNAL> = 1.77V
<SIGNAL>PP1V8_UPC_XA_LDOD</SIGNAL> = 1.79V
<SIGNAL>PP1V1_UPC_XA_LDO_BMC</SIGNAL> =1.11V

Should I replace <CHIP>U3100</CHIP> again or look for something else?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-0923</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> don't charge or boot
threads.message:
Check all its related resistors.
Compare diode mode readings in various points with other channel.
